evidence.title: README (segment 1)
evidence.excerpt: A production-ready template to build fast, secure desktop apps with Tauri and Vue.

evidence.title: README (segment 2)
evidence.excerpt: - **Vue 3 + TypeScript** - Type-safe frontend with devtools - **Tailwind 4** - CSS preconfigured for native app development - **Vite** - Fast builds with [AutoImport](https://github.com/antfu/unplugin-auto-import) for cleaner code - **Vitest** - Unit testing ready to go - **CI/CD included** - GitHub Actions for automated testing, builds, and releases - **VS Code ready** - Debugging configs and recommended extensions

evidence.title: README (segment 4)
evidence.excerpt: 1. Run the development server (starts both the backend and frontend dev servers and opens the devtools):

evidence.title: README (segment 5)
evidence.excerpt: - **Core Process** (`backend`, or _main_ process in Electron terminology) - **WebView process** (`frontend`, _renderer_ in Electron)

evidence.title: README (segment 8)
evidence.excerpt: - The `dev` command has by default `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` set which makes Rust output full backtraces to the console. (Remove it from the `package.json` command if you don't want it). - If you use VS Code, you can debug Rust code with the included `Debug Tauri` config.

evidence.title: v2.9.3
evidence.excerpt: - Feat: added `rust-toolchain.toml` to explicitly set stable toolchain. See [CHANGES.md](https://github.com/Uninen/tauri-vue-template/blob/main/CHANGES.md) for a complete list of changes. > [!NOTE] > these macOS builds are unsigned. To prevent the "tauri-app is damaged and cannot be opened" security warning, run this command after moving the app to Applications folder: > ```bash > xattr -c /Applications/tauri-app.app > ``` > See https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri-action/issues/866 for details.

evidence.title: v2.9.0
evidence.excerpt: See [CHANGES.md](https://github.com/Uninen/tauri-vue-template/blob/main/CHANGES.md) for a complete list of changes. > [!NOTE] > macOS builds are not signed so in order to run the app, after moving the app to Applications folder you need to run xattr -c /Applications/tauri-app.app in the terminal. (See tauri-apps/tauri-action#919)

evidence.title: v2.6.0
evidence.excerpt: This release bumps Tauri to [version 2.6.0](https://tauri.app/release/tauri/v2.6.0/) and updates the Webview versions to `chrome107` and `safari16` which matches Vite 7 defaults and [Baseline Widely Available](https://web-platform-dx.github.io/web-features/) features. This makes figuring out supported features much easier. See [CHANGES.md](https://github.com/Uninen/tauri-vue-template/blob/main/CHANGES.md) for a complete list of changes. > [!NOTE] > macOS builds are not signed so in order to run the app, after moving the app to Applications folder you need to run `xattr -c /Applications/tauri-app.app` in the terminal. (See tauri-apps/tauri-action#919)

evidence.title: ROOT_FILES
evidence.excerpt: .editorconfig, .eslintrc-auto-import.json, .github, .gitignore, .prettierrc.json, .vscode, CHANGES.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, LICENSE, README.md, auto-imports.d.ts, bump-version.cjs, components.d.ts, env.d.ts, eslint.config.cjs, index.html, package.json, pnpm-lock.yaml, public, rust-toolchain.toml, src-tauri, src, tests, tsconfig.app.json, tsconfig.json, tsconfig.node.json, tsconfig.vitest.json, vite.config.ts, vitest.config.ts
